title: WiSniff
description: WiSniff is a network tool designed to capture and analyze Wi-Fi traffic for detecting anomalies and potential security threats.
introduction: WiSniff is an innovative network security project aimed at providing a robust solution for monitoring and securing Wi-Fi networks. The tool captures and analyzes wireless traffic to identify suspicious activities, offering a crucial layer of defense against cyber threats.

sections.title: Motivation and Initial Development
sections.body: The motivation behind WiSniff stemmed from the growing need for effective Wi-Fi security tools. Many existing solutions are either too complex or insufficiently comprehensive. We began development using Python with libraries like Scapy for packet capture and NumPy/Pandas for data analysis. Initial challenges included handling large volumes of data and ensuring real-time processing capabilities.

sections.title: Real-Time Detection Implementation
sections.body: We introduced real-time traffic analysis by integrating machine learning algorithms to detect anomalies. Using Scikit-learn, we trained models to recognize patterns in normal traffic, enabling the system to flag unusual activities. This phase also saw the development of a user-friendly dashboard using Dash to visualize traffic data and alerts.

sections.title: User Interface and Accessibility
sections.body: To make WiSniff accessible to a broader audience, we developed an intuitive web interface using Flask. This interface allows users to view traffic statistics, receive alerts, and configure detection parameters. We ensured cross-platform compatibility and optimized the UI for responsiveness and ease of use.

sections.title: Future Enhancements
sections.body: Future plans include expanding the anomaly detection algorithms to cover more threat types, such as ransomware and unauthorized access attempts. We also aim to enhance filtering options to reduce false positives and integrate WiSniff with popular security information and event management (SIEM) systems for comprehensive threat management.
